title: All MPs must publish their educational qualifications: SJB MP
byline: While highlighting that the false claim by Speaker Ashoka Ranwala on his doctorate has degraded Parliament, Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Harshana Rajakaruna said today that all Members of Parliament should publish their educational qualifications.

title: US: plane crashes onto Texas highway, splits in half; four injured video
byline: A twin-engine propeller plane crashed onto a Texas highway on Wednesday and split into two parts, damaging cars and injuring at least four people in the process, according to authorities.

title: Indian national arrested for alleged match-fixing in Lanka T10 league
byline: An Indian national, the owner of the ’Galle Marvels’ team in the Lanka T10 Super League, has been arrested by the Special Police Unit for the Prevention of Misconduct Related to Sports on charges of alleged match-fixing.

title: Yala National Park overcrowded again
byline: A recent decision by the Department of Wildlife Conservation to increase the number of Safari jeeps to 550 into the Yala National Park has received backlash from animal rights activists who claim that the National Park is facing a threat of overcrowding and this is a violation of animal rights.

title: Some 50,000 monkeys residing in villages and urban areas causing issues - report
byline: The most recent statistics indicate that out of the estimated 300,000 monkeys in the country, around 50,000 monkeys are causing issues by residing in villages and urban areas.

title: Biden commutes nearly 1,500 sentences, pardons 39 people
byline: United States President Joe Biden has commuted nearly 1,500 prison sentences and pardoned 39 people in what the White House has described as the largest act of clemency in a single day in the country’s modern history.

title: US re-emphasizes importance of IMF programme,encourages continuous engagement
byline: In the wake of the visit of Assistant Secretary of State for South and Central Asia Donald Lu as the first highest level engagement with the new government in Sri Lanka, the United States said it views the IMF (International Monetary Fund) programme as essential to Sri Lanka’s economic recovery and resilience and encourages continued engagement to drive sustainable growth and improve livelihoods.

title: Sri Lanka completes sovereign bond exchange
byline: The government has announced the successful completion of its International Sovereign Bonds (ISBs) exchange offer, with 98% of bondholders participating.

title: Minor fire at Herali restaurant in Colombo 2
byline: A fire broke out at Herali restaurant in Colombo 2 on Friday, the Fire Service Department said.

title: Ukraine facing ’massive’ Russian attack on energy sector
byline: Russia launched a widespread attack on Ukraine’s energy infrastructure overnight, forcing the country to implement emergency power outages, Ukrainian authorities said on Friday.

title: Govt MPs failing to prove qualifications should resign: Namal
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) MP Namal Rajapaksa urged government MPs to resign if they fail to provide evidence of their educational qualifications, echoing the recent resignation of Speaker Ashoka Ranwala.

title: President to embark on first overseas visit to India
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is set to make his inaugural state visit to India from December 15 to 17, 2024, at the invitation of Indian President Droupadi Murmu, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced today.

title: NDF to propose Select Committee to review educational qualifications of NPP MPs
byline: The New Democratic Front (NDF) Parliamentary Group Leader, Jeewan Thondaman, is expected to propose the establishment of a select committee to review the educational qualifications of all Members of Parliament (MPs) of National People’s Power (NPP)

title: Members appointed to Port City Economic Commission
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake officially appointed members to the Port City Economic Commission, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: Govt spends Rs. 214 bn annually on alcohol-related health issues
byline: The government spends Rs. 214 billion annually to address health issues related to alcohol consumption, highlighting the significant social, economic and health challenges posed by alcohol.

title: South Indian actor Allu Arjun arrested over ’Pushpa 2: The Rule’ stampede
byline: South Indian superstar Allu Arjun was arrested on December 13 in connection with a devastating stampede at the December 4 premiere of his film Pushpa 2: The Rule at Sandhya Theatre in Hyderabad, which claimed the life of a 39-year-old woman and critically injured her young son.

title: ’’Dr’’ title added mistakenly to Justice Minister’s profile: Parliament clarifies
byline: Clarfying the removal of the title ’’Dr’’ for Justice Minister  Harshana Nanayakkara from the Parliament website, the Parliament media unit said the title was mistakenly added before the name of the Justice Minister and that it has now been corrected.

title: Increased Customs tax prevents selling rice at controlled price: Importers
byline: Even though the required stocks of rice have been imported into the country, releasing these stocks to the local market has been difficult due to an increase in Customs duty charged per kilogram, a rice importer said.

title: Latvia blocked fertiliser shipment to SL for over two years, claims Russian Ambassador
byline: Russian Ambassador Levan S. Dzhagaryan alleged yesterday that Latvia, a European Union country, blocked a shipment of free fertiliser to Sri Lanka for over two years.

title: Anyone found guilty of wrongdoing will face consequences: President
byline: Claiming that the government will not shield anyone who errs, for any reason, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said today anyone found guilty of wrongdoing will face the consequences.

title: SJB MPs to sign no-faith motion on Speaker today
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MPs are to begin placing their signatures to the no-confidence motion that is to be brought in against Speaker Asoka Ranwala today.

title: CPC refutes fuel shortage
byline: The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) yesterday refuted certain reports about a possible fuel shortage due to a fuel shipment imported by a private company being sent back.

title: US: plane crashes onto Texas highway, splits in half; four injured
byline: A twin-engine propeller plane crashed onto a Texas highway on Wednesday and split into two parts, damaging cars and injuring at least four people in the process, according to authorities.
